Description: Green glazed composition amulet in the form of a hare; suspension ring behind the ears.
Curator's comments: Hares were associated with regeneration and fertility, and the amulets may have been worn to grace the bearer with the same attributes in life or after death. Hare amulets are first attested in the late Old Kingdom but were most popular in the Late Period. Published in: Andrews, C. 1994. Amulets of Ancient Egypt, p.61, see pp.63-4 for general hare amulets Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, p. 42
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt
